title: Unable to connect to the authentication service
body: please help i tried repairing with the hextech tool and intiated full repair and it doesnt work.

replies.body: Hey guys, after some further troubleshooting with another player I believe we've fixed the issue, give it another shot.
Darn that problem ruined my christmas. I wonder if i could get some RP for that ;).
Please submit a fix to EUW? I have the issue there as well
so 3 days ago, I couldn't log in. 2 days ago, I was able to log in and play 2 games. However, I still can't log in yesterday and today. Is there a problem with preseason patch or something?

Hello, I help maintain the authentication service that error message is talking about, we've gotten a few reports of this happening to various people.

We are having a rough time finding anything wrong on our end that would cause this issue (it's only happening to a small number of players) - would you be able to tell me what antivirus programs you have installed on your computer?

Could I also get what windows version you're using, as well as which ISP you use for internet?

i use avg 
using windows 10
Spectrum

> [{quoted}](name=W1Kung,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=FWtFX4Wl,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-12-26T03:48:56.605+0000)
>
> i use avg 
> using windows 10
> Spectrum

we MAY be on to something here, is there a way you can temporarily disable AVG for a bit and try again? Please let me know the outcome of this.
I disabled avg and tried to log on but it doesnt work

Darn, as another quick check can you try loading https://auth.riotgames.com/.well-known/openid-configuration in your web browser. It should just look like a bunch of configuration text if it loads correctly.
I saw a bunch of text

After getting a few more reports so far it seems like it's not the antivirus that matters, but may only be happening on some windows 10 installations. I need to look through some more reports to see if the trend continues. It's possible a new windows update went out that broke something.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Daguava,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=FWtFX4Wl,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-26T04:24:27.938+0000)
>
> After getting a few more reports so far it seems like it's not the antivirus that matters, but may only be happening on some windows 10 installations. I need to look through some more reports to see if the trend continues. It's possible a new windows update went out that broke something.

Its happening to me and im on a MacBook Air
